p: To test the fit of the model equation, the regression model was established using R 2 as a measure of how much variability in the observed response values can be explained by the experimental factors and their interactions [44]. The R 2 value is always between 0 and 100% [ 37, 45]. However, to create a good-fit model, it was recommended that R 2 should not be less than 80% [46]. The results in Table 7 indicate an R 2 value of 99.69% which leaves only 0.31% of the variability not explains by biodiesel, this showed that unexplainable total variation could be due to other factors, which were not included in the model.
